I found the PDF for only $10 on borders.com, which is a subset of
amazon. You have to go to borders.com, click on "store locator," then
click "search inventory." Type the title and the first hit is the PDF
version for $9.99. I couldn't find it on amazon.com.

http://www.bordersstores.com/search/title_detail.jsp?id=54548917&srchTerms=junit+recipes&mediaType=1&srchType=Keyword

Michael.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Shane Mingins <shanemingins@y...> wrote:
> I tend to like a book too, although that is basically
> for ease of reading.  I bought the PDF form and print
> chapters to read on the train (a lot lighter to carry
> than a full book).  But I love the ease of use of the
> PDF to go back an find things!  
> 
> Plus for me the price was great as shipping to NZ was
> free ;-)  With my last book purchase from Amazon the
> shipping cost was over half the cost of the book!  The
> price to pay for living in the best part of the world
> I s'pose :-)
> 
> --- Michael <mkoss917@y...> wrote:
> 
> > I ordered it from Amazon on June 16 and I am still
> > waiting for my copy
> > to ship. Amazon says it will ship by the 22nd, if
> > not, I may cancel
> > the order and buy the PDF version, although I really
> > like having my
> > books in book form, not electronic.
> > 
> > Michael.
